title: Ted Naifeh: Polly and the Pirates (Oni) (2005) (Team-DCP)
description:
" Anastasia says that Turkish Princes pay unimaginable sums for attractive young 
   Western girls. To what purpose, it's inappropriate for a proper young lady even 
   to contemplate. I don't know where Anastasia learnt such shocking things, but I 
   suspect she read them in 'novels'. "

    - Polly Pringle, in "Polly and the Pirates" issue one.

---

   Premise:

"Proper young lady" Polly Pringle is shanghaied out of her boarding school dormitory by a pirate crew in want of a captain. Hilarity (and swashbuckling) ensues.

If you've read Naifeh's "Courtney Crumrin", you now know what to expect, because this is EXACTLY how one would naively imagine that particular author to tackle this particular concept. Even the ships (see above) look just like Crumrin House!

And if you've not read "Courtney Crumrin"... do so ( <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9206290" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9206290</a>  ), and forget about this one for now, would be my advice.

---

   Single volume compiled from DCP's traditional scans of the six-part series.
   Quality varies a bit from issue to issue, but is quite acceptable overall.
